Cote d'ivoire - Second Projet Hevea
            de Grand-Bereby

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Second Grand-Bereby
            Rubber Project for the Ivory Coast was successful. The
            project achieved its objectives, sustainability is likely,
            and the performance of both the Bank and Borrower was
            satisfactory. Several lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, providing adequate housing and social
            amenities is the key to retaining labor and avoiding
            expensive recruitment schemes. Second, the thorough training
            of tappers and foremen is essential, insofar as having a
            major positive effect on the project's main physical
            asset, trees. Third, the timely and adequate compensation of
            dispossessed farmers is essential to ensure full
            participation of the latter in any scheme. Fourth, turning
            traditional subsistence farmers into rubber growers was
            complex, especially since most of the farmers had better
            cash incomes as fishermen and seafarers. Finally, lengthy
            bureaucratic procedures, particularly in approving the
            annual budget and processing disbursement applications, can
            unnecessarily jeopardize the smooth implementation of a project.
